data.name: Hard Surface in Zbrush: Recovery Truck
data.detailed_description:
Steam Video

This content is only available in an online streaming format. More information about streaming videos can be found in the Streaming Videos on Steam FAQ.


About the Video

In part I of this tutorial I build the base of the truck in Zbrush using references and discuss hard surface techniques and various tricks used in the pipeline for look development. In part II of this tutorial I add a hookloader to the back of the truck and continue adding other details in Zbrush. I discuss my decisions and strategies regarding design and explain my thinking process when building realistic mechanisms. In part III ( the final part) of this tutorial I talk about texturing and rendering in Keyshot 5 and finalizing the image in Photoshop.
data.about_the_game: In part I of this tutorial I build the base of the truck in Zbrush using references and discuss hard surface techniques and various tricks used in the pipeline for look development. In part II of this tutorial I add a hookloader to the back of the truck and continue adding other details in Zbrush. I discuss my decisions and strategies regarding design and explain my thinking process when building realistic mechanisms. In part III ( the final part) of this tutorial I talk about texturing and rendering in Keyshot 5 and finalizing the image in Photoshop.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 5Mbps for 540p, 3Mbps for 360p.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I3+ or AMD equivalent recommended for HD 1080p playback
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 12Mbps for 1080p or 8Mbps for 720p.
